titleStmt.title: The iudgement of that reuerend and Godly lerned man, M. Lambert Danæus, touching certaine points now in controuersie, contained in his preface before his commentary vpon the first Epistle to Timothie, written in Latine, and dedicated by him to the Prince of Orange. But novv translated into Englishe, for the behofe and comfort of all those, who (not vnderstanding the Latine tongue) are desirous to know the trueth in those points
In D. Pauli priorem epistolam ad Timotheum commentarius. English. dedication
titleStmt.author: Daneau, Lambert, ca. 1530-1595?

titleStmt.title: The iudgement of that reuerend and Godly lerned man, M. Lambert Danæus, touching certaine points now in controuersie, contained in his preface before his commentary vpon the first Epistle to Timothie, written in Latine, and dedicated by him to the Prince of Orange. But novv translated into Englishe, for the behofe and comfort of all those, who (not vnderstanding the Latine tongue) are desirous to know the trueth in those points
In D. Pauli priorem epistolam ad Timotheum commentarius. English. dedication
titleStmt.author: Daneau, Lambert, ca. 1530-1595?

notesStmt.note: A translation of the dedication of Daneau, Lambert. In D. Pauli priorem epistolam ad Timotheum commentarius.
The end of text is dated: Geneva 1577, as in Daneau's original work--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
